<a href="style=%22border-bottom:none!important;%22" target="_blank"></a>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Did you see this? Monday night, Elon Musk replied to a tweet about Bill Gates (who bought a Porsche Taycan, not a Tesla) with: “My conversations with Gates have been underwhelming tbh.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How scandalous! We came up with a few more:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“My experience taking off these ski boots has been underwhelming tbh” </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“This </span><span><em>Freaks and Geeks </em></span><span>episode has been underwhelming tbh”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Eating this tub of raw cookie dough has been underwhelming tbh”</span></li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRIMINAL JUSTICE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/18/president-trump-pardons-michael-milken?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Trump Is Milken His Executive Powers
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Michae" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyMDY1ODEwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Frederick M. Brown/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday was a good day to be a famous white-collar criminal. President Trump flexed his executive power to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-18/trump-commutes-prison-sentence-of-blagojevich-pardons-kerik?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hand out commutations or pardons</a> to 11 convicted felons. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Several are once-powerful people whose cases commanded national attention. Trump commuted the 14-year prison sentence of former Illinois Gov. Rod Blagojevich, who was found guilty of shopping around former President Barack Obama's open Senate seat in 2011. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Blagojevich was also once a contestant on Trump's reality show, </span><span><em>Celebrity Apprentice.</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quick civics refresher: </strong>The U.S. Constitution grants the president almost total clemency power. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">One famous financier made the list </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trump <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/18/trump-pardons-michael-milken-face-of-1980s-financial-scandals.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pardoned Michael Milken</a>, the philanthropist and former chief of the high-yield bond department at the now-defunct investment bank Drexel Burnham Lambert. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Think Martha Stewart, but replace the cake recipes with medical donations. Once known as the “junk bond king,” Milken was involved in a high-profile insider trading scandal in the 1980s. In 1990, he was convicted of a bucket of securities violations, fined $600 million, and sentenced to 10 years in prison. He served 22 months. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ever since his 1993 release, Milken has been fighting for a pardon. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Pardons can return certain rights to people convicted of crimes, though the White House said Milken’s lifetime ban from the securities industry would stay put.  </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Milken’s straightened himself out since prison</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now 73, he’s a successful investor as well as a major donor to cancer research. He founded and chairs the Milken Institute, a think tank that publishes economic research and hosts an annual gathering in <span>Beverly Hills </span>attended by the movers, shakers, ballers, and shot-callers in finance. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Forbes says Milken is the </span><span><a href="https://www.forbes.com/profile/michael-milken/#8844860b390e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">217th-richest person</a></span><span> in the world. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Trump said he hasn’t ruled out pardoning longtime associate Roger Stone. The DOJ’s softening of Stone’s recommended sentence last week has caused a major scandal.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F02%2F18%2Fpresident-trump-pardons-michael-milken" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/18/kickstarter-employees-join-tech-industrys-first-union?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Kickstarting the Union
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Following a 46–37 vote, Kickstarter employees will become the first white collar <a href="https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/3a8pp5/kickstarter-employees-win-historic-union-election?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tech workers to unionize</a> in the U.S.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What they want:</strong></span><span> Pay equity, transparency around hiring, support for workers who surface problems, and a voice at the leadership table. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kickstarter, a popular crowdfunding platform, has long been a bumper-sticker liberal. In 2015, it became a <a href="https://www.legalzoom.com/articles/advantages-of-turning-your-business-into-a-public-benefit-corporation?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">public benefit corporation</a>, and it's thrown resources behind progressive causes from net neutrality to trans rights. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But problems started bubbling in 2018. One <a href="https://slate.com/technology/2019/09/kickstarter-turmoil-union-drive-historic-tech-industry.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Nazi-related controversy</a> and a federal labor complaint later, workers announced plans to unionize last March. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In December, after months of trying to squash unionization, Kickstarter's management </span><span><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/kickstarter-workers-vote-form-first-union-tech-industry-n1138006?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">backed off</a></span><span> and let the organizers organize as long as they didn’t talk to reporters.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Anyone who's dropped in for all-you-can-eat scallop sashimi at the Google cafeteria knows why the tech industry has been slow to embrace unionization. But from 2017–2019, tech worker protests almost tripled, ignited by issues from immigration to contract workers' rights. In the last few years, Google and Instacart contractors have successfully unionized with their employers. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/18/bloomberg-releases-plan-rein-wall-street?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Benedict Bloomberg Turns His Back on Wall Street
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Former Mayor Michael Bloomberg speaking with attendees at the Presidential Gun Sense Forum hosted by Everytown for Gun Safety and Moms Demand Action at the Iowa Events Center in Des Moines, Iowa." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyMDU5MDIxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Gage Skidmore</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Memelord and Democratic presidential candidate Mike Bloomberg released a plan yesterday that would tighten the leash on the financial services industry. His <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/mike-bloombergs-wall-street-plan-includes-taxing-stock-trades-and-other-financial-transactions/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">proposals</a> include...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Reversing many of the Trump administration’s banking deregulations</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Strengthening the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Phasing in a financial transaction tax of 0.1% for every stock or bond traded</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Et tu, Bloomberg? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That Mike Bloomberg, a former bond trader and the <em>founder of a financial data company</em>, would stab Wall Street on the Senate floor reflects the scars left by the financial crisis on voters. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Given how profoundly the 2008 crisis undermined faith in the establishment...authorities everywhere should be doing all in their power to fix the flaws it revealed," the plan states.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Bloomberg's plan is a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/18/business/dealbook/michael-bloomberg-wall-street.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">U-turn</a> from his previously held positions on banking and aligns him more with the conventional thinking of the Democratic party.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Bloomberg will present his plan IRL tonight at the Democratic primary debate in Las Vegas, the first debate he's qualified for. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking further ahead...</strong>a top adviser to Bloomberg <a href="https://apnews.com/5a50e9104533b34193e3f5909130e9d9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> he would sell his company, Bloomberg LP, if elected president. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

The Future Pulled a Fast One

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As a young boy many moons ago, I was rather confident I would one day live on the moon, my imagination running wild with visions of writing stellar ad copy from an interstellar perch. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Why compare life insurance? Because the same policy can vary in price from insurer to insurer by an average of $133 per month—<strong style="color:#000">that’s $1,500 or more a year you could save</strong> by using <a href="https://www.policygenius.com/life-insurance/no-zip-mlp-1/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=paid-email&utm_campaign=life-ins-feb-2020&utm_content=cta1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Policygenius</a> to compare and buy life insurance.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whatever it is you guessed wrong 20 years ago, at least you can choose the right life insurance with <a href="https://www.policygenius.com/life-insurance/no-zip-mlp-1/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=paid-email&utm_campaign=life-ins-feb-2020&utm_content=cta1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Policygenius</a> today.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/18/susan-fowlers-highly-anticipated-memoir-published?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Susan Fowler Serves Revenge in Hardback
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Susan Fowler speaks at SXSW" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyMDYxMzQyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Rita Quinn/Getty Images for SXSW</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, NYT tech op-ed editor Susan Fowler released her memoir, <em>Whistleblower</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Where you've heard that name before: </strong>In December 2016, Fowler quit her software engineering job at Uber. A few months later, she wrote a <a href="https://www.susanjfowler.com/blog/2017/2/19/reflecting-on-one-very-strange-year-at-uber?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blog post</a> about her time there. It wasn't pretty. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Fowler said she was harassed at Uber, starting with her first day on a new team. When she tried to complain, HR and upper management ignored or tried to intimidate her. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Before Fowler's earthquake of a post, Uber was among Silicon Valley's most prestigious and valuable companies. Now, brash founder Travis Kalanick is out of the picture while the reputation of the broader tech industry has taken a hit. Fowler's activism was a major contributor to the shift.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Fowler's story is an indictment of superficial corporate diversity measures that cover up discriminatory behavior. "Uber didn't just need more women engineers, or more employees of color," <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/02/18/804501264/uber-whistleblower-takes-on-silicon-valley-armed-with-stoic-philosophy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">she writes</a> in <em>Whistleblower</em>. “It needed to stop breaking the law.”</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/18/virgin-galactic-shares-soar-thanks-retail-investors?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Virgin Galactic's FOMO Rally
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An illustration of a Virgin Galactic spaceship flying around Eart" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyMDYzMjA3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In October, Richard Branson's Virgin Galactic became the first commercial space tourism company to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/27/virgin-galactic-goes-public?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">go public</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, after another solid day on the NYSE, it became the first commercial space tourism company whose stock has rallied over 400% since early December. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Virgin Galactic shares are getting a boost from non-professional investors, </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-virgin-galactic-stocks/virgin-galactics-stock-soars-fueled-by-retail-investors-idUSKBN20C2E9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Reuters reports</a></span><span>. It trails only Apple and Tesla as the third most traded stock on Fidelity's online brokerage in recent trading sessions.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And last week, the company moved </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/02/18/investing/virgin-galactic-stock/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one step closer</a></span><span> to sending tourists to space when it transported its SpaceShipTwo plane to Spaceport America, its base in New Mexico. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>If you want to invest in space tourism, Virgin Galactic's currently your only bet. Analysts think that's probably inflated the value of the company beyond the "fundamentals," but its stock market success could put pressure on rivals SpaceX and Blue Origin. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Speaking of SpaceX...</strong>the company said it's <a href="https://apnews.com/779530a4788cade2d71e25c67d4e0f56?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hoping to send</a> up to four tourists into super high orbit as early as the end of next year.</p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ok, not technically real estate...but it is someone’s home. You’re looking at a “<a href="https://www.buslifeadventure.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">skoolie</a>,” a term for a school bus converted into a mobile living space. Think of it as a tiny home on wheels.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The specs for <a href="https://tinyhouselistings.com/listings/converter-school-bus-skoolie-ready-to-make-new-memories?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this bus/house</a>:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Three RV style roof-mounted air conditioners</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Flush toilet and outdoor shower </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>2003 bus model with 143,000 miles and a 7.3L diesel engine</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>King-sized master bedroom in the back </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>No seatbelts </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Are you about that bus life? </strong>See if you can guess the asking price for this skoolie. Answer at the bottom.</p>

\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStocks were pretty quiet yesterday, so let’s talk about share buybacks\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e—when a company repurchases stock to return money to shareholders\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Companies bought back just \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/18/buybacks-are-off-to-their-worst-start-in-7-years-but-that-could-change.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$13.7 billion of stock\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in January, the slowest opening to a year since 2013. But in the first two weeks of February, they already hit $34 billion.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nCRIMINAL JUSTICE \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/18/president-trump-pardons-michael-milken?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nTrump Is Milken His Executive Powers\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Michae\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyMDY1ODEwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrederick M. Brown/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday was a good day to be a famous white-collar criminal. President Trump flexed his executive power to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-18/trump-commutes-prison-sentence-of-blagojevich-pardons-kerik?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehand out commutations or pardons\u003c/a\u003e to 11 convicted felons. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSeveral are once-powerful people whose cases commanded national attention. Trump commuted the 14-year prison sentence of former Illinois Gov. Rod Blagojevich, who was found guilty of shopping around former President Barack Obama's open Senate seat in 2011. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBlagojevich was also once a contestant on Trump's reality show, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eCelebrity Apprentice.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuick civics refresher: \u003c/strong\u003eThe U.S. Constitution grants the president almost total clemency power. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOne famous financier made the list \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTrump \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/18/trump-pardons-michael-milken-face-of-1980s-financial-scandals.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epardoned Michael Milken\u003c/a\u003e, the philanthropist and former chief of the high-yield bond department at the now-defunct investment bank Drexel Burnham Lambert. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThink Martha Stewart, but replace the cake recipes with medical donations. Once known as the “junk bond king,” Milken was involved in a high-profile insider trading scandal in the 1980s. In 1990, he was convicted of a bucket of securities violations, fined $600 million, and sentenced to 10 years in prison. He served 22 months. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEver since his 1993 release, Milken has been fighting for a pardon. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePardons can return certain rights to people convicted of crimes, though the White House said Milken’s lifetime ban from the securities industry would stay put.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMilken’s straightened himself out since prison\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow 73, he’s a successful investor as well as a major donor to cancer research. He founded and chairs the Milken Institute, a think tank that publishes economic research and hosts an annual gathering in \u003cspan\u003eBeverly Hills \u003c/span\u003eattended by the movers, shakers, ballers, and shot-callers in finance. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eForbes says Milken is the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/profile/michael-milken/#8844860b390e?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e217th-richest person\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the world. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eTrump said he hasn’t ruled out pardoning longtime associate Roger Stone. The DOJ’s softening of Stone’s recommended sentence last week has caused a major scandal.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nKickstarting the Union\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFollowing a 46–37 vote, Kickstarter employees will become the first white collar \u003ca href=\"https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/3a8pp5/kickstarter-employees-win-historic-union-election?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etech workers to unionize\u003c/a\u003e in the U.S.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat they want:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Pay equity, transparency around hiring, support for workers who surface problems, and a voice at the leadership table. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKickstarter, a popular crowdfunding platform, has long been a bumper-sticker liberal. In 2015, it became a \u003ca href=\"https://www.legalzoom.com/articles/advantages-of-turning-your-business-into-a-public-benefit-corporation?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epublic benefit corporation\u003c/a\u003e, and it's thrown resources behind progressive causes from net neutrality to trans rights. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut problems started bubbling in 2018. One \u003ca href=\"https://slate.com/technology/2019/09/kickstarter-turmoil-union-drive-historic-tech-industry.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNazi-related controversy\u003c/a\u003e and a federal labor complaint later, workers announced plans to unionize last March. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn December, after months of trying to squash unionization, Kickstarter's management \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/kickstarter-workers-vote-form-first-union-tech-industry-n1138006?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebacked off\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and let the organizers organize as long as they didn’t talk to reporters.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAnyone who's dropped in for all-you-can-eat scallop sashimi at the Google cafeteria knows why the tech industry has been slow to embrace unionization. But from 2017–2019, tech worker protests almost tripled, ignited by issues from immigration to contract workers' rights. In the last few years, Google and Instacart contractors have successfully unionized with their employers. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eReversing many of the Trump administration’s banking deregulations\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStrengthening the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePhasing in a financial transaction tax of 0.1% for every stock or bond sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eEt tu, Bloomberg? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat Mike Bloomberg, a former bond trader and the \u003cem\u003efounder of a financial data company\u003c/em\u003e, would stab Wall style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"Given how profoundly the 2008 crisis undermined faith in the establishment...authorities everywhere should be doing all in their solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eU-turn\u003c/a\u003e from his previously held positions on banking and aligns him more with the conventional thinking of the Democratic party.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eBloomberg will present his style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, NYT tech op-ed editor Susan Fowler released her memoir, \u003cem\u003eWhistleblower\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhere you've heard that name before: \u003c/strong\u003eIn December 2016, Fowler quit her software engineering job at Uber. A few months later, she wrote a \u003ca href=\"https://www.susanjfowler.com/blog/2017/2/19/reflecting-on-one-very-strange-year-at-uber?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblog post\u003c/a\u003e about her time there. It wasn't pretty. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFowler said she was harassed at Uber, starting with her first day on a new team. When she tried to complain, HR and upper management ignored or tried to intimidate her. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eBefore Fowler's earthquake of a post, Uber was among Silicon Valley's most prestigious and valuable companies. Now, brash founder Travis Kalanick is out of the picture while the reputation of the broader tech industry has taken a hit. Fowler's activism was a major contributor to the shift.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Fowler's story is an indictment of superficial corporate diversity measures that cover up discriminatory behavior. \"Uber didn't just need more women engineers, or more employees of color,\" \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/02/18/804501264/uber-whistleblower-takes-on-silicon-valley-armed-with-stoic-philosophy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshe writes\u003c/a\u003e in \u003cem\u003eWhistleblower\u003c/em\u003e. “It needed to style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, after another solid day on the NYSE, it became the first commercial space tourism company whose stock has rallied over 400% It trails only Apple and Tesla as the third most traded stock on Fidelity's online brokerage in recent trading sessions.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd last week, the company moved \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/02/18/investing/virgin-galactic-stock/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eone step closer\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to sending tourists to space when it transported its SpaceShipTwo plane to Spaceport America, its base in New Mexico. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eIf you want to invest in space tourism, Virgin Galactic's currently your only bet.
